In a recent speech, Mr. Thomas D. Morris,
Assistant Secretary of Defense for Manpower,
said:
"The values we are seeking are more
effective human resources available
for more of their time...with a smaller
drain on our training resources both
human and physical..."
Mr. Morris' idea is central, also, to the rationale
for using mass communications, in the contexts we
are indicating here. We too, are deeply concerned
with economical, propitious use of time, as well
as dollars. The fact is, we can, through mass
communications, bring more education, more job-
skill training, more information, to more people
in less time than is possible through other, more
conventional distribution systems.
